description: UMD 3.1.1 is a revision of 3.1.0 made available for the EGI production infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes: <div>This release contains the following products:</div><div><b>EMI Technology Provider:</b><br></div><div>Client tools:<br></div><div>EMI UI v. 3.0.1-1 both in SL5 and SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This release its a repacking version and just solves the missing dependencies on gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli.<br></li></ul></div><div>GFAL/lcg_util 1.15.0 &nbsp;both in SL5 and SL6:<br></div><div><ul><li>This release contains no new functionalities and provides solutions to several bugfixes for the mkgltempdir, lcmaps lcmaps-plugins-basic and lcmaps-plugins-voms packages.</li></ul></div><div>CANl 2.1.1 both in SL5 and SL6:</div><div><ul><li>This release introduces new features in caNl-Java, specifically PKCS12 keystores supporting unlimited JCA policy and a new method to save a X509Credential as a PEM keystore. caNl-c API has ben extended with an function to set OCSP URL.<br></li><li>This release also adress several bugfixes namelly the one on which the ProxyCSRGenerator assigns a wrong serial for RFC proxies.<br></li></ul></div><br/>
installationNotes: All products in the UMD 3.1.1 release were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the documentation links) to support 64 bit Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze). &nbsp;Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: <div>For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk to make a report.<br></div>
knownIssues: <div>Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and staged rollout are collected in:&nbsp;<a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.1.1">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.1.1</a></div>
changeLog: <div>This releases includes updates for the following products:</div><div><ul><li>Gfal-lcg_util<br></li><li>EMI-UI</li><li>CANl<br></li></ul></div>

products.name: emi.canl
products.releaseNotes: This release introduces new features in caNl-Java, specifically PKCS12 keystores supporting unlimited JCA policy and a new method to save a X509Credential as a PEM keystore. caNl-c API has ben extended with an function to set OCSP URL. Documentation was updated accordingly.

products.name: emi.emi-ui
products.releaseNotes: Added missing dependencies on gsi-openssh-clients and glite-ce-monitor-cli

products.name: emi.gfal-lcg_util
products.description:
GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

The version 2.0 of GFAL tries to simplify at the maximum the file operations in a distributed environment.

the complexity of the grid is hidden from the client side behind a simple common POSIX API.

GFAL 2.0 is able to manage all the common used file access protocols in a grid environment  Dcap GSIDCAP, LFN RFIO (  DPM or CASTOR )  SRM,  GridFTP,  HTTP/WebDav .
